content: What's the name of the 19th-century British author known for his vivid characters and tales set in London, such as "Oliver Twist" and "A Christmas Carol"?

That would be Charles Dickens. He's one of the most famous authors in English literature, known for his rich characterizations and social commentary in works like "Oliver Twist," "A Christmas Carol," "Great Expectations," and many others. His stories often portray the struggles of the poor and the working class in 19th-century London and are celebrated for their memorable characters and powerful narratives.
